content: Anyone know why my CSS changes aren't taking effect straight away? Normally I can make a change to the theme's CSS file, save, then reload the site to see the CSS take effect. But it's not working currently and I have to clear caches each time I make a change. All caching and aggregation on admin/config/development/performance is turned off...

Ha, apparently I've come across this before and filed an issue for it :smiling_face: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4086

Changes to CSS not reflected until after cache clear · Issue #4086 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Description of the bug When all caching and aggregation is disabled, and you make a change to a theme's CSS file, the change isn't reflected on the site after a simple browser refresh, you ...
I think this is Color-module related. Updated the issue to reflect that.
Yes, if you are using the color module, you need to resave your color settings so it will regenerate the files.
I thought we had an issue somewhere to regenerate the color files when caches are cleared, but I can't seem to find it atm

@Joseph Flatt https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4295 I referenced that issue in my update.

[DX] Themes with color support: CSS changes not taking effect unless theme settings are re-saved. · Issue #4295 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Description of the need I just ran into a situation in which I made a css change and could not get it to take effect, regardless of how many times I cleared the browser cache or the Backdrop cache....
